results.title: Treatment with atenolol prevents progression of microalbuminuria in type I diabetic patients.
results.text_hl: Treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ prevents progression of microalbuminuria in @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_1</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003922 @@@type I diabetic@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.

citations.NLM: Tindall H, Urquhart S, Stickland M, Davies JA. Treatment with atenolol prevents progression of microalbuminuria in type I diabetic patients. Curr Med Res Opin. 1991;12(8):516-20. PMID: 1764955

results.title: Effect of atenolol on QTc interval lengthening during hypoglycaemia in type 1 diabetes.

results.title: [The effects of bisoprolol and atenolol on glucose metabolism in hypertensive patients with non-insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus].
results.text_hl: Effects of @CHEMICAL_Bisoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017298 @@@bisoprolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ on @CHEMICAL_Glucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005947 @@@glucose@@@ metabolism in @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_1</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003922 @@@NIDDM@@@.

results.title: Effects of atenolol and enalapril on kidney function in hypertensive diabetic patients.
results.text_hl: The aim of the study was to evaluate the efficacy of @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ in decreasing the severity of @DISEASE_Proteinuria @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@ in @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ suffering from @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_1</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003922 @@@insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus@@@.

citations.NLM: De Cesaris R, Ranieri G, Filitti V, Andriani A, Bonfantino MV. Effects of atenolol and enalapril on kidney function in hypertensive diabetic patients. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 1993 Aug;22(2):208-14. PMID: 7692159

results.title: Association between cardiac autonomic dysfunction and inflammation in type 1 diabetic patients: effect of beta-blockade.
results.text_hl: HRV parameters improved significantly in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, but not in the no-@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ group.

citations.NLM: Lanza GA, Pitocco D, Navarese EP, Sestito A, Sgueglia GA, Manto A, Infusino F, Musella T, Ghirlanda G, Crea F. Association between cardiac autonomic dysfunction and inflammation in type 1 diabetic patients: effect of beta-blockade. Eur Heart J. 2007 Apr;28(7):814-20. PMID: 17371783

results.title: Glucose turnover in type I diabetic subjects during exercise. Effect of selective and nonselective beta-blockade and insulin withdrawal.
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVE: To assess the effect of selective beta 1-blockade (@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Betaxolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015784 @@@betaxolol@@@) and nonselective beta-blockade (@CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@) on @CHEMICAL_Glucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005947 @@@glucose@@@ turnover in subjects with @<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_1</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003922 @@@insulin-dependent (type I) diabetes mellitus@@@ during moderate exercise.

citations.NLM: Benn JJ, Brown PM, Beckwith LJ, Farebrother M, Sönksen PH. Glucose turnover in type I diabetic subjects during exercise. Effect of selective and nonselective beta-blockade and insulin withdrawal. Diabetes Care. 1992 Nov;15(11):1721-6. PMID: 1468307

results.title: Hypertension in Diabetes Study IV. Therapeutic requirements to maintain tight blood pressure control.
results.text_hl: No difference was seen between those allocated to @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@captopril@@@.

results.title: New approaches to the uses of beta blocking drugs in hypertension.
results.text_hl: Likewise, recent studies have shown that @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ was at least as effective as @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@captopril@@@ in improving the outlook in @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with non-@<m>DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_1</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003922 @@@insulin dependent diabetes@@@.

citations.NLM: Prichard BN, Graham BR, Cruickshank JM. New approaches to the uses of beta blocking drugs in hypertension. J Hum Hypertens. 2000 Apr;14 Suppl 1():S63-8. PMID: 10854083
